p: In all four locations, interspecific competition intensity was significantly stronger ( P < 0.05) at invaded relative to non-invaded quadrats. Species richness was significantly higher in non-invaded compared to invaded quadrat in Zhangjiakou (83.49 vs. 57.00), Huailai (57.15 vs. 21.14), Yangyuan (67.83 vs. 32.67), and Fushun (96.60 vs. 63.20) described in Fig 4. Maximum interspecific competition was found in invaded quadrats at Huailai (41%; Fig 4B), which indicates that X. strumarium competes with native plant species greatly in studied ecosystems. However, 14% and 12% interspecific competitions were found at invaded quadrats in Zhangjiakou and Yangyuan, respectively ( Fig 4A and 4C). In Zhangjiakou S. feberi (34%), in Fushun S. feberi and S. viridis recorded maximum relative abundance in its non-invaded quadrats ( Fig 4C and 4D).
